learning_outcomes.description: read a range of passages based on parts of speech and syntax covered in the JACT Reading Greek course.
translate into good English a range of passages covered in the JACT Reading Greek course.
recognise and classify several parts of speech according to their declensions or conjugations.
parse (give the grammatical properties of) several parts of speech covered in the JACT Reading Greek course.

assessments.task_description:
Task: The participation mark evaluates student preparedness, which is demonstrated through in-class translation of set lines and active engagement in discussions directed by the lecturer. These discussions will focus on points of grammar, literary technique, and relevant historical or cultural contexts. Students are encouraged to use the class time to proactively identify and address problems encountered during preparation.

AI: This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

Marking Criteria:
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Task: Quizzes are held weekly in-class and assess foundational skills from the preceding material, covering vocabulary, grammar exercises, translation (both Greek-to-English and English-to-Greek), and parsing. There are 10 quizzes, each marked out of 15. Each student's mean average will determine their final 15% mark for this component.

This assessment is designed to promote continuous engagement and immediate application of content.

Quizzes will be peer marked and collected by the lecturer during class.

Hurdle Requirements: you must complete (and therefore attend) at least 7 out of 10 quizzes in order to pass the course. If you are unable to attend due to illness or misadventure, please contact Dr. Florence as soon as possible to discuss alternative arrangements and obtain a medical certificate (if relevant). 

Please note that the following are not acceptable reasons for missing a quiz: 

  • Computer or internet problems
  • Holidays (including overseas travel)
  • Unexpected events causing the loss of revison time
  • Normal stress or anxiety associated with study (in the absence of a relevant SAP)
  • Moving house (with possible exceptions if the move is sudden and involuntary)
  • Social or leisure events (other than sporting or cultural activities at an elite level)
  • Ordinary family events or commitments
  • Ordinary work commitments
  • Forgetting to attend class


AI: This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: All marked quizzes must be returned to the lecturer following peer marking.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Task: The mid-semester exam will consist of a variety of accidence, grammatical, translation and comprehansion questions. It will cover the passages studied in Reading Greek Text and Grammar, Sections 1A-2D. The exam will include the translation of a simple sentence from English into Greek.

AI: This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The exam will be completed in class and the exam paper collected by the lecturer
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.assessment_title: Final exam: scheduled by UQ Examinations
assessments.task_description:
Task:  The final exam will comprise a combination of the following: 

  • Translation from Greek into English of a section of text from Sections 1A - 6D of Reading Greek Text & Vocabulary (your translations must demonstrate that you understand the Greek); Parsing to demonstrate understanding of the text; 
  • Translation of an unseen passage based on the learning vocabulary set for the 1A - 6D (again, your translations must demonstrate that you understand the Greek); 
  • Comprehension questions.

Further details will be available on the course Blackboard site.

AI: This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
